segments.text: Excuse me , you look familiar . Did you use to live in New York ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Did you use to work at NYU ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Oh , did you know Hugh Young ? He was a music student .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Hugh Young ? Didn ’ t he use to wear a funny yellow jacket all the time ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes . And he used to play the piano with a jazz group at the university .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I remember Hugh . Most people thought he was a little ... uh ... peculiar . Do you know what he ’ s doing now ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes , he ’ s a millionaire in Houston now .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: A millionaire ? As a jazz musician ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Oh , no . He ’ s an executive for a large computer company . I saw an interview with him on TV yesterday . They were asking his opinion about future uses for computers .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well ! I guess people don ’ t find him so peculiar anymore .
segments.speaker: S2
